subject.geographic: Near Washington, Parish of St. Landry, La

mods.abstract: $25 REWARD. Runaway, from the undersigned, near Washington, Parish of St. Landry. on the 9th of July last. a negro man of a griff color, named Ephraim, aged about 22 years, about 5 feet 11 inches high, raw boned, having a scar about his face, a few spots about the mouth and a mark on one of his cheeks; -- Was bought in March last from M. Elam, a negro trader in New-Orleans. The above reward will be given to whomseover will bring said boy back to the undersigned, or a liberal reward if lodged in one of the Jails of this State. WM. F. DAVIS St. Landry, August 25th 1860.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
